instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.

threads.title: 820 00045, don't turn ON
threads.message:
Hey guys, 

working on 820 00045, No one touch on this board before me and don't have any corrosion! the customer said that he stopped working suddenly! 

All "G3Hot" (Always-Present) Rails are present and stable until <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>. 

From <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> are pulsing! 

For example <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> are pulsing 5V and off - 5v and off! Like to <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> 1.1V and off repeatedly! 

Already replace <CHIP>U4700</CHIP> for a new one and no changes! 

Any idea to this one?? already searched on forum but i can't find any problem related to this! 

thanks

threads.title: 820 00045, don't turn ON
threads.message: Check for shorts across all rails. If no shorts, this one may not be good news. CPUs dropping like flies on these things.

threads.title: 820 00045, don't turn ON
threads.message:
VCORE pulsing too?
CPU is the first suspect on these boards...

threads.title: 820 00045, don't turn ON
threads.message: Yeah same if VCore pulses you can always try a new BIOS but at least the last 30 12? MacBooks I?ve had have all had bad CPUs

threads.title: 820 00045, don't turn ON
threads.message:
Hey guys, 

After Easter holidays this motherboard don't have more rails pulsing! All rails even Vcore are constant! I can feel the board warm like a working board! 

Already heat the processor a bit, but don't changes! I think the CPU it's damage! 

It's possible on this mode even with damaged processors to recover the information on internal SSD? 

Other question its possible to reprogram the bios on this models with TL866 for example ?

threads.title: 820 00045, don't turn ON
threads.message: Yeah dead CPU 100% RIP. I am not sure on data recovery I am curious as well! BIOS can be programmed but it is BGA, so you have to remove it, reball, solder to programmer, remove, reball, and resolder without breaking it...better to use something like Medusa to access the BIOS through JTAG connector.
